Manx: Ny ta Yeesey mac Siracc gra mychione yn fer-lhee.
English: What Jesus son of Sirach says about the doctor.
Diplomatic: Ny ta Yeesy mac Sirack gra mychione yn ferlhee

Manx: Cur e ooashley cooie da’n er-lhee, son y feme foddee ve ayd er, son ta’n Chiarn er n’ordrail eh. Son veih’n er smoo syrjey ta lheiys cheet, as yiow eh ooashley veih’n Ree. Nee schleï yn er-lhee troggal eh gys ooashley, as bee eh ayns goo mie mastey ny hard gheiney. Ta’n Çhiarn er chroo medshinyn ass y thalloo as cha jean dooinney creeney soiaghey beg jeu.
English: Give the doctor his due honour, for the need you may have for him, because the Lord has ordered it. For, it is from the greatest, highest one, that healing comes, and he will receive praise from the King. The art of the doctor will raise him to adoration and he will be in good fame amongst the men in authority. The Lord has created medicines out of the earth and a wise man will not despise them.
Diplomatic: Cur e ooashley cooie da’n er-lhee, son y feme foddee ve ayd er son ta’n Chiarn er n’ordrail eh. Son veih yn er smoo syrjey ta lheiys cheet, as yiow eh ooashley veihyn Ree. Nee shlei yn er-lhee troggal eh gys ooashley as bee eh ayns goo mie mastey ny ard gheiney. Ta’n Chiarn er chroo medshinyn ass y thalloo as cha jean dooinney creeney soiaghey beg jeu.

Manx: Nagh row yn ushtey jeant oor lesh fuygh, dy voddagh pooar Yee ve er ny hoilshaghey? As t’eh er choyrt schleï da deiney dy vod ooashley ve echey ayns e obbraghyn. Lesh nyn lheid t’eh coyrt lheihys, as leodaghey nyn bianyn. Jeh nyn lheid ta’n potecaree jannoo seose e haaseyn-lheihys. gyn jerrey ta y obbraghyn as voishyn ta aash feaï-ny-cruinney.
English: Wasn’t the water made fresh by wood, so that God’s power could could be revealed? And he has given skill to men so that he might have honour in his works. To such as they he brings healing, and lessens their pains. Of such as these, the chemist makes up his treatments. There is no end to his works and from him there is easement throughout the world.
Diplomatic: Nagh row yn ushtey jeant oor lesh fuygh, dy voddagh pooar Yee ve er ny hoilshaghey As t’eh er choyrt schlei da deiney dy vod ooashley ve echey ayns e obbraghyn. Lesh nyn lheid t’eh coyrt lheihys, as leodaghey nyn bianyn. Jeh nyn lheid ta’n potecaree jannoo sose y haaseyn lheihys gyn jerrey ta y obbraghyn as voishyn ta aash feai-ny-cruinney.

Manx: Eisht cur fys er yn er-lhee, son ta’n Çhiarn er n’ordrail eh. Ny lhig da gholl void, son ta feme ayd er. Son ta traa ayn dy vel bannaght Yee gholl marish ny laueyn oc. Son gowee adsyn neesht nyn badjer gys y Chiarn dy vannaghey shen ny ta’d dy choyrt son aash as, as foays as bea liauyr.
English: Then, let the doctor know, for the Lord has ordered it. Do not let him leave you, because you need him. For there is a time when God’s blessing goes with their hands. For they will also take their prayers to the Lord to bless that which they give for relief, and benefit and long life.
Diplomatic: Esht cur fys er yn er-lhee, son ta’n Chiarn er n’ordrail eh. ny lhig da gholl void, son ta feme ayd er. Son ta traa ayn dy vel bannaght Yee gholl marish ny laueyn oc. Son gowee adsyn neesht nyn badjer gys y Chiarn dy vannaghey shen ny ta’d dy choyrt son aash as, as foays as bea liauyr.

Manx: Eshyn ta jeh y yoin jannoo peccah noi e er-croo lhig da tuittym fo laue yn ferlhee.
English: He who deliberately commits a sin against his creator, let him fall under the hand of the doctor.
Diplomatic: Eshyn ta jeh y yoin jannoo peccah noi e er-croo lhig da tuittym fo laue yn ferlhee.
